column4: anyone know how to fix this this console-setup install problem? bah, what a piece of shit this is
is this IRC channel just for people to ask questions and not get answers?
Please be patient.
Can you pastebin the entire error message you are getting?
http://pastebin.com/X5xUHAt2
I'm looking at your issue, not sure what the problem is yet.
Is this an upgrade or right after an upgrade?
yeah, part of apt-get dist-upgrade
Please tell me you aren't upgrading from something to natty with that.
I am, but I did all the previous steps like search/replace everything in sources to "natty", e tc.
Thats not the proper way to upgrade to a new release. You should be using do-release-upgrade  (or update-manager if you prefer the gui) .
That file has been migrated from one package to another and apt-get isn't smart enough to handle that on its own. I don't know what to suggest if d-r-u didn't work for you :/
any ideas how to informat apt of this change manually? too late for d-r-u anyway. there must be a way to fix this ridiculous problem
*inform, I mean
I wonder if you install --reinstall both packages if it will work.
not working
it says "trying to overwrite '/etc/init.d/console-setup', which is also in package console-setup 1.57ubuntu20" ... but this file isn't even there
This is really iffy, but you could use dpkg --force-conflicts with the package in /var/cache/apt/archives/
--force-conflicts with what command?
dpkg --force-conflicts -i /var/cache/apt/archives/keyboard-configuration_1.57ubuntu20_all.deb
sorry :/
that's alright, not your fault. it's amazing how much of a POS ubuntu is with respect to its installation/package management... epic fail.
